summary: This document is an investigative summary dated August 10, 2019, detailing the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death by suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9-10, 2019. It provides a timeline of his incarceration, a previous suicide attempt, and reveals that BOP guards falsified logs and that video surveillance was broken. It notes the involvement of the OIG and FBI.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the document; found unresponsive in his cell at MCC on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead. The summary details his incarceration timeline and previous suicide attempt.

events.title: Epstein arrives at BOP MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Epstein placed on suicide watch
events.description: Epstein was placed on suicide watch and underwent observations.

events.title: Epstein's first suicide attempt
events.description: Epstein attempted suicide via hanging at 0127 hours. He had a cellmate at the time and was subsequently placed on special observation until July 29, 2019.

events.title: Cellmate released, Epstein left alone
events.description: Epstein's cellmate was brought to court and released, leaving Epstein alone in his cell.

events.title: Epstein makes unsecured phone call
events.description: At 1919 hours, a BOP recorded line shows Epstein made a 19-second phone call on an unsecured and unmonitored line. Details of the call are unknown.

events.title: Epstein found dead
events.description: Epstein was discovered unresponsive in his cell at approximately 0633 hours with a torn piece of bedding around his neck affixed to his bunk bed. CPR and medical intervention failed, and he was pronounced dead after transport to a hospital.

events.title: Surveillance cameras reported broken
events.description: Video surveillance of the hallway capturing Epstein's cell was reported 'broken' with no record made. Hard drives were later seized by FBI/OIG personnel.

locations: BOP medical room (second floor of MCC)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC on August 10, 2019, with a torn piece of bedding around his neck, affixed to his bunk bed.
The Office of the Inspector General (OIG) was informed that at least one BOP guard falsified logs regarding mandatory rounds, and a criminal case was opened.
Video surveillance of the hallway to Epstein's cell was reported broken on August 8, 2019, with no record made; the hard drives were seized by the FBI/OIG.
Epstein had a previous suicide attempt via hanging on July 23, 2019, while he had a cellmate, and was on special observation until July 29.
On August 9, 2019, Epstein's cellmate was released, leaving him alone in his cell, and later that evening he made a 19-second unsecured and unmonitored phone call.
